lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin min ko cmqkwr vwrau; ssIAr sUr kot kotin pRgws jI [

Unknown.translation: Shine of millions and millions of gems and pearls, light of countless Suns and Moons, are paltry and worthy of sacrifice over the obedient Sikh whose forehead is able to kiss the dust of the feet of the True Guru.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: kRoVwˆ kotIAwˆ mxIAwˆ dy cmqkwr; Aru kRoVwˆ kRoV cMdRmw sUrj dy pRkwS vwr G`qwˆ Es qoˆ[

lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin Bwig pUrn pRqwp Cib; jigmig joiq hY sujs invws jI [

Unknown.translation: The glory of millions of fortunate people and the glow of supreme honour is trivial before the beautiful sheen of the forehead that has acquired the dust of the feet of the True Guru.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: AYsw hI Bwgwˆ Anuswr pRwpq hox hwry pUrn pRqwp dI iCqwilAw vMdI iekbwl vMdI dy cotI aupr pujy hx dI suMdRqw ijs dI joq dmk, dgmg kr rhI hovy qy jo sRySt j`s dI AsQwn hY: Bwv ijs dy pRBwv kr ky cOˆhI ckIˆ kIrqI PYlI hoeI hovy; AYho jyhIAwˆ kRoVwˆ kotIAwˆ pRqwp Cbwˆ BI vwr is`tw Es qoˆ[

lines.gurmukhi: isv snkwid bRhmwidk mnorQ kY; qIrQ kotwin kot bwCq hY qws jI [

Unknown.translation: Shiv Ji, the four sons of Brahma (Sanak etc.), Brahma himself, that is the three prime gods of Hindu pantheon crave for the glorious dust of the True Guru's feet. Countless places of pilgrimage also long for this dust.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: kRoVo kRoV = AsMKÎwq iSvjI Aru snkwidk qQw bRhmw Awidk locdy rihMdy hn; Es nUM Aqy qIrQ BI ie`Cw krdy rihMdy hn Es dI[

lines.gurmukhi: msqik drsn soBw ko mhwqm AgwiD boD; sRI gur crn rj mwqR lwgY jws jI [421[

Unknown.translation: The forehead that acquires a small amount of dust of the lotus feet of the True Guru, the glory of his glimpse is beyond description.  (421)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: qy Es dy m`Qy dy drSn dI SoBw dy mhwqm dw boD buJnw smJnw AgwD AQwh rUp hY; ijs dy ik m`Qy aupr sRI gurU mhwrwj dy crxwˆ dI DUVI mwqR hI kyvl lgI hovy ]421]
